page.title: 04HURCOTT VILLAGE.
page.content: {Hurcott Village}has been created out of one of the oldest sites in British papermaking history dating back to the Middle Ages.It was owned by the Earls of Dudley and paper was hand made by monks.By 1635 it was owned by Thomas Blount and paper making continued on the site until 1973 when it was closed due to modern technological competition.It was then used as a furniture store but a disastrous fire ,causing the deaths of local firemen, destroyed a great part of the original buildings. These have now been rebuilt into a modern development beside the old mill pool surrounded by fields and trees but convenient to the town. The pool is an attraction for wild life and a good place for fishing.
